fulltext:
Nguyen Thi Ngoc Yen 
Cell phone: +84 943 561 300 
Email: ngocyen113@gmail.com 
Address: M-One Apartments, 35/12 Be Van Cam Street,  
Ward Tan Kieng, District 7, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam 
About me:  
Work is my first priority. It is meaningful to me to find a good product and contribute to its success. 
I’m a hard-working person with high sense of responsibility. I am confident in building solid relations 
with partners during face to face contacts as well as via email and telephone.  My negotiation skills 
and keen eye on details help me to ensure quality of the products while maintaining a win-win 
relationship.   
Career Summary: 
TOONG CO-WORKING SPACE – THE OPEN HOUSE., JSC 
Regional Operations Manager: 2019 – Present 
Responsibilities: 
Responsibilities towards the company: 
▪ 
Managing 5 Co-working stations with 35 employees and around 1000 customers in southern 
Vietnam and Cambodia  
▪ 
Establishing and launching 4 upcoming stations in 2019 
▪ 
Building brand service standards and applying to all stations in southern Vietnam and Cambodia 
▪ 
Maintaining signature standards of the working environment  
▪ 
Creating and implementing standard operation procedures 
▪ 
Creating and implementing training programs for new staff 
▪ 
Creating annual business and budget plan 
▪ 
Analyzing financial reports to coordinate and improve the sales and marketing strategy with the 
Business Development manager 
▪ 
Supporting to extend Sales and Marketing activities to existing customers   
▪ 
Negotiating with partners for competitive contract benefits 
▪ 
Managing operating expenses and income to meet the KPI 
▪ 
Reporting directly to the General Manager 
Responsibilities towards customers: 
▪ 
Being central point of communication for tenants 
▪ 
Creating measurement tools for customer satisfaction 
▪ 
Building a healthy tenant community by organizing connecting activities 
▪ 
Scheduling und supervising information events 
▪ 
Supervising problem-solving cases 
▪ 
Creating the debt collection policy to minimalize risks of late payments 
▪ 
Maintaining a positive relationship all stakeholders including investors, tenants, partners 
supplier etc. 
Key achievements: 
▪ 
Creating brand service standards 
▪ 
Established standard operation standards and policies 
▪ 
Increasing the total occupancy by 11% 
▪ 
Creating a healthy working environment for employees 
PASSAGE TO ASIA Co. Ltd 
Office Manager: 2017 – 2018 
Operations Manager: 2016 – 2017 
Operations Executive: 2014 – 2016 
Responsibilities: 
▪ 
Managing the head office and representative offices in Danang and Hanoi to ensure smooth 
operations 
▪ 
Managing tour income and expenses 
▪ 
Creating the annual business plan (market expansion, brand marketing, increasing sales 
channels, minimalize expenses, improve the service quality) 
▪ 
Managing suppliers and partners in all regions with special focus on Hanoi (lots of guest in 
Hanoi) 
▪ 
Coordinating suppliers’ services to meet overseas agents’ satisfaction 
▪ 
Organizing tour programs including accommodation and golf course reservation, guide 
assignment and transportation arrangement 
▪ 
Negotiating with partners for competitive contract benefits 
▪ 
Creating quotations and selling tours to overseas tour operators 
▪ 
Conducting sales calls in Singapore (done) and Hong Kong (scheduled) 
▪ 
Representing the company at the Asia Golf Tourism Conventions and creating new business 
relationships 
▪ 
Organizing FAM-trips for overseas partners 
▪ 
Organizing Golf Tournaments for overseas tour operators 
▪ 
Handling VIP clients’ special requests 
▪ 
Establishing and maintaining professional relationships with overseas tour operators as well as 
local suppliers 
▪ 
Solving problems and reporting to the Director 
Key achievements: 
▪ 
Increasing customer satisfaction resulting in returning bookings 
▪ 
Efficient financial management resulting in an increase of 7% profit 
▪ 
Successful tour arrangement for the Director of the Swiss Ice hockey League, Dennis Vaucher 
INDOCHINA HERITAGE 
Freelance Mice supporter 
2013 – 2017 
Responsibilities: 
▪ 
Assisting the Mice Manager 
▪ 
Managing timeline and program tasks 
▪ 
Arranging services for team-building programs including booking of venues, cultural 
performances and logistics  
▪ 
Negotiating with suppliers for best contract benefits 
INDOCHINA SERVICES TRAVEL GROUP  
Logistics Operator 
2012 – 2014 
Responsibilities: 
▪ 
Managing vehicle suppliers and contracts in all regions of Vietnam 
▪ 
Booking vehicles and drivers 
▪ 
Managing drivers’ schedules 
▪ 
Problem solving of driver and vehicles related issues 
▪ 
Updating and preparing monthly reports directly to the Logistics Manager 
▪ 
Working under pressure during high season 
 Viet Travel, Vietnam Feltival, Lua Viet and other Travel agencies. 
 Tour guide freelance 
2010 – 2011 
Responsibilities: 
▪ 
Providing tour guiding services for Vietnamese guests 
▪ 
Services arrangements during tours including restaurant reservations, check-in services and 
tour vehicle arrangements 
▪ 
Reporting customers’ feedbacks promptly to the company. 
▪ 
Ensuring guests’ satisfaction 
Education: 
2013 -2017 :  
Bachelor, Majoring in Journalism and Communication 
The University of Social Science and Humanity 
2008 – 2012:  
Bachelor, Majoring in Tourism Geography 
The University of Social Science and Humanity 
2010 – 2012:  
Certificate,  Majoring in Tourism Geography 
L’Universite de Pau et des pays d’Adour  
Qualifications:  
▪ 
MS Office skills including Word, Excel, PowerPoint,  and Access 
▪ 
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely in both English and Vietnamese; reading and 
writing in French 
▪ 
Ability to thrive in a fast paced, dynamic environment both independently and as part of a team 
▪ 
Honest and reliable, dedicated to quality work, ensuring accuracy in all procedures 
▪ 
Strong organizational, interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to independently 
plan, prioritize and multi-task to meet deadlines 
▪ 
Good work ethics and ability to appropriately handle confidential information 
References: 
TOONG CO-WORKING SPACE – THE OPEN HOUSE., JSC 
Flat-ship address: 126 Nguyen Thi Minh Khai Street, Ward 6, District 3, HCMC 
Tel: 024 39263888 
Website: https://toong.asia/ 
PASSAGE TO ASIA Co. Ltd, 
Address: 27 Thai Van Lung Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, HCMC 
Tel: 028 38270230 
Website: http://www.passagetoasia.co/
